Module Contents

django.views.debug.DEBUG_ENGINE[source]
django.views.debug.builtin_template_path(name)[source]

Return a path to a builtin template.

Avoid calling this function at the module level or in a class-definition because __file__ may not exist, e.g. in frozen environments.

exception django.views.debug.ExceptionCycleWarning[source]

Bases: UserWarning

Base class for warnings generated by user code.

class django.views.debug.CallableSettingWrapper(callable_setting)[source]

Object to wrap callable appearing in settings. * Not to call in the debug page (#21345). * Not to break the debug page if the callable forbidding to set attributes

(#23070).

django.views.debug.technical_500_response(request, exc_type, exc_value, tb, status_code=500)[source]

Create a technical server error response. The last three arguments are the values returned from sys.exc_info() and friends.

class django.views.debug.SafeExceptionReporterFilter[source]

Use annotations made by the sensitive_post_parameters and sensitive_variables decorators to filter out sensitive information.

cleansed_substitute = '********************'[source]
hidden_settings[source]
cleanse_setting(key, value)[source]

Cleanse an individual setting key/value of sensitive content. If the value is a dictionary, recursively cleanse the keys in that dictionary.

get_safe_settings()[source]

Return a dictionary of the settings module with values of sensitive settings replaced with stars (*****).

get_safe_request_meta(request)[source]

Return a dictionary of request.META with sensitive values redacted.

get_safe_cookies(request)[source]

Return a dictionary of request.COOKIES with sensitive values redacted.

is_active(request)[source]

This filter is to add safety in production environments (i.e. DEBUG is False). If DEBUG is True then your site is not safe anyway. This hook is provided as a convenience to easily activate or deactivate the filter on a per request basis.

get_cleansed_multivaluedict(request, multivaluedict)[source]

Replace the keys in a MultiValueDict marked as sensitive with stars. This mitigates leaking sensitive POST parameters if something like request.POST[‘nonexistent_key’] throws an exception (#21098).

get_post_parameters(request)[source]

Replace the values of POST parameters marked as sensitive with stars (*****).

cleanse_special_types(request, value)[source]
get_traceback_frame_variables(request, tb_frame)[source]

Replace the values of variables marked as sensitive with stars (*****).
